intro.description: The next steps show you how to work with the library of Test Cases to create your tests. The library contains actions you will need to automate your tests, and is organized into categories based on the action to perform, and the component to perform the action on.

item.title: Open the Test Case Editor
item.description: Double-click on the Test Case you just created to open the Test Case Editor

item.title: Add an "Activate Application" Test Case
item.description:
In the Test Case Browser, open the category:
unbound_modules_concrete > Actions (basic) >Activate Application

subitem.label: "Drag the "ub_app_activate[ACTIVATION_METHOD]" Test Case from this category and drop it into the Test Case Editor (in the middle of the perspective).
The "activate application" Test Case clicks once in the place you specify to ensure that your application has focus before beginning the test.

item.title: Add a parameter value
item.description: In the Properties View, enter TITLEBAR into the empty parameter value field for the "ub_app_activate" Test Case and press enter.

item.title: Add two "Replace Text" Test Cases
item.description:
In the Test Case Browser, open the category:
unbound_modules_concrete > Actions (basic) >Input via Keyboard > Component with Text Input

subitem.label: Drag the "ub_cti_replaceText" Test Case from this category and drop it into the Test Case Editor, underneath the "activate" Test Case you just referenced.
Repeat the action so that you have two ""ub_cti_replaceText" Test Cases in the Test Case Editor.

item.title: Rename the referenced Test Cases
item.description:
In the Properties View, rename the first "ub_cti_replaceText" Test Case to:
Enter first value
by entering this new name in the Test Case Reference Name field.
Rename the second "ub_cti_replaceText" Test Case to:
Enter second value
This makes the test more readable.

item.title: Add references as parameters
item.description: In the Properties View, enter =VALUE1 into the empty parameter value field for the first "ub_cti_replaceText" Test Case and press enter.

subitem.label: In the Properties View for the second "ub_cti_replaceText" Test Case, enter =VALUE2 into the parameter value field and press enter.

item.title: Reassign the component names
item.description: In the Component Names View, enter adder_value1_txf in the new name field for the first "ub_cti_replaceText" Test Case. Enter adder_value2_txf for the second "ub_cti_replaceText" Test Case.

item.title: Add a "Click" Test Case
item.description:
In the Test Case Browser, open the category:
unbound_modules_concrete > Actions (basic) > Click

subitem.label: Drag the "ub_grc_clickLeft_single" Test Case into the Test Case Editor, underneath the other items.clicked and checked.

item.title: Rename the referenced Test Case
item.description:
In the Properties View, rename the "ub_grc_clickLeft_single" Test Case to:
Click equals

item.title: Reassign the component name
item.description: In the Component Names View, enter adder_equals_btn in the new name field.

item.title: Add a "Check Text" Test Case
item.description:
In the Test Case Browser, open the category:
unbound_modules_concrete > Actions (basic) > Check > Component with Text

subitem.label: Drag the "ub_ctx_checkText" Test Case into the Test Case Editor, underneath the other items.

item.title: Rename the referenced Test Case
item.description:
In the Properties View, rename the "ub_ctx_checkText" Test Case to:
Check result

item.title: Add a reference and a parameter
item.description:
In the Properties View, enter =RESULT as the Text parameter and press enter.
Enter equals as the operator parameter and press enter..

item.title: Reassign the component name
item.description: In the Component Names View, enter adder_result_txf in the new name field.

item.title: Finishing the Test Case
item.description:
Save the editor.
You now have a Test Case which will enter any two values into two fields, click the "equals" button and check the result.
Check that the Test Cases are in the right order - the activate application should come first, then the two replace texts, then the click, and then the check.
